item.title: Julia add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The more I know of the world, the more I am convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love. I require so much!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Julia add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There are few people whom I really love, and still fewer of whom I think well. The more I see of the world, the more am I dissatisfied with it; and every day confirms my belief of the inconsistency of all human characters, and of the little dependence that can be placed on the appearance of merit or sense." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Julia add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "It is a fair, even-handed, noble adjustment of things, that while there is infection in disease and sorrow, there is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humour." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Julia add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of any thing than of a book! -- When I have a house of my own, I shall be miserable if I have not an excellent library." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Julia add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Julia add a quote by Richard Wilbur
item.description: "What is the opposite of two? A lonely me, a lonely you." -- Richard Wilbur

item.title: Julia add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "After nourishment, shelter and companionship, stories are the thing we need most in the world." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Julia add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Julia add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Julia add a quote by Orson Welles
item.description: "My doctor told me to stop having intimate dinners for four. Unless there are three other people." -- Orson Welles

item.title: Julia add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Joy is the best makeup." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Julia add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
item.description: "I never change, I simply become more myself." -- Joyce Carol Oates

item.title: Julia add a quote by Andre Gide
item.description: "It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not." -- Andre Gide

item.title: Julia add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Julia add a quote by William Ernest Henley
item.description: "It matters not how strait the gate, How charged with punishments the scroll, I am the master of my fate: I am the captain of my soul." -- William Ernest Henley

item.title: Julia add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "Men are more interesting in books than they are in real life." -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Julia add a quote by Arundhati Roy
item.description: "To love. To be loved. To never forget your own insignificance. To never get used to the unspeakable violence and the vulgar disparity of life around you. To seek joy in the saddest places. To pursue beauty to its lair. To never simplify what is complicated or complicate what is simple. To respect strength, never power. Above all, to watch. To try and understand. To never look away. And never, never to forget." -- Arundhati Roy

item.title: Julia add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "In vain have I struggled. It will not do. My feelings will not be repressed. You must allow me to tell you how ardently I admire and love you." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Julia add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "If the real world were a book, it would never find a publisher. Overlong, detailed to the point of distraction-and ultimately, without a major resolution." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Julia add a quote by Nicole Krauss
item.description: "there are two types of people in the world: those who prefer to be sad among others, and those who prefer to be sad alone." -- Nicole Krauss

item.title: Julia add a quote by Daphne du Maurier
item.description: "But luxury has never appealed to me, I like simple things, books, being alone, or with somebody who understands." -- Daphne du Maurier

item.title: Julia add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Julia add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Julia add a quote by Niccolò Machiavelli
item.description: "Everyone sees what you appear to be, few experience what you really are." -- Niccolò Machiavelli

item.title: Julia add a quote by Bei Dao
item.description: "In the world I am Always a stranger I do not understand its language It does not understand my silence" -- Bei Dao

item.title: Julia add a quote by Bill Nye
item.description: "Everyone you will ever meet knows something you don't." -- Bill Nye

item.title: Julia add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "It's only those who do nothing that make no mistakes, I suppose." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Julia add a quote by Christopher Morley
item.description: "There is indeed a heaven on this earth, a heaven which we inhabit when we read a good book." -- Christopher Morley

item.title: Julia add a quote by Christopher Morley
item.description: "The beauty of being a bookseller is that you don't have to be a literary critic: all you have to do to books is enjoy them." -- Christopher Morley

item.title: Julia add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "We live for books." -- Umberto Eco
